{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|make_tagged_pair}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/utility/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/utility|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; TagSpecifier Tag1, TagSpecifier Tag2, class T1, class T2 &gt;
constexpr ranges::tagged&lt;/*see below*/, Tag1, Tag2&gt; make_tagged_pair( T1&amp;&amp; x, T2&amp;&amp; y );
}}

Convenience function for creating a tagged pair, deducing the element types from the arguments (the tag specifiers must be explicitly specified).

The ''see below'' portion of the return type is {{c|decltype(std::make_pair(std::forward&lt;T1&gt;(x), std::forward&lt;T2&gt;(y)))}}.

===Return value===
{{c|R(std::forward&lt;T1&gt;(x), std::forward&lt;T2&gt;(y))}}, where {{tt|R}} is the return type.
